page.title: 16Garton C.E. Church Part 1
page.content: St. Michael and All Angels Church is the oldest and most beautiful building in Garton. It was built by Prior John of Kirkham Abbey in 1132. The plain, aisleless structure is predominantly Norman in style. The church has a chancel, south porch and massive west tower. A great restoration took place in 1856 largely financed by Sir Tatton Sykes of Sledmere House. The chancel and the nave were rebuilt but not the south wall. The tower was repaired and the bells re-hung. A rare and unique feature of the church is the interior decoration. Every space on the walls and roof has been painted with bible scenes and patterns. These were done by two artists, Clayton and Bell, between 1872-80 costing Â£8,000. The formal mosaic floors are black, white and yellow.
